dt: {bc}a form or model proposed for imitation {bc}{sx|exemplar||}
{bc}something designed or used as a model for making things
{bc}an artistic, musical, literary, or mechanical design or form

dt.t: the strict {wi}pattern{/wi} of rhythm and rhyme for a sonnet

dt: {bc}a length of fabric sufficient for an article (as of clothing)
{bc}the distribution of shrapnel, bombs on a target, or shot from a shotgun
{bc}the grouping made on a target by bullets
{bc}a reliable sample of traits, acts, tendencies, or other observable characteristics of a person, group, or institution
{bc}the flight path prescribed for an airplane that is coming in for a landing
{bc}a prescribed route to be followed by a pass receiver in football
{bc}a discernible coherent system based on the intended interrelationship of component parts

pt: {sc}model{/sc} {sc}example{/sc} {sc}pattern{/sc} {sc}exemplar{/sc} {sc}ideal{/sc} mean someone or something set before one for guidance or imitation. {sc}model{/sc} applies to something taken or proposed as worthy of imitation.

pt.t: a decor that is a {it}model{/it} of good taste

pt: {sc}example{/sc} applies to a person to be imitated or in some contexts on no account to be imitated but to be regarded as a warning.

pt.t: children tend to follow the {it}example{/it} of their parents

pt: {sc}pattern{/sc} suggests a clear and detailed archetype or prototype.

pt.t: American industry set a {it}pattern{/it} for others to follow

pt: {sc}exemplar{/sc} suggests either a faultless example to be emulated or a perfect typification.

pt.t: cited Joan of Arc as the {it}exemplar{/it} of courage

pt: {sc}ideal{/sc} implies the best possible exemplification either in reality or in conception.

pt.t: never found a job that matched his {it}ideal{/it}

et: Middle English {it}patron{/it}, from Anglo-French, from Medieval Latin {it}patronus{/it}
shortdef: a form or model proposed for imitation : exemplar
something designed or used as a model for making things
an artistic, musical, literary, or mechanical design or form

dt: {bc}to make, adapt, or fashion according to a pattern
{bc}to furnish, adorn, or mark with a design

shortdef: to make, adapt, or fashion according to a pattern

dt.t: Then, Dorsey massages his image with reporters; he … creepily {wi}repatterns{/wi} his speech after Steve Jobs …
… represents an important opportunity for parents to help {wi}re-pattern{/wi} the way boys view girls …
